Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nigedeb
Reviews.Content: Piazza di Spagna View, Rome is perfect for couples wanting to see Rome All the main attractions are within walking distance we are both in our mid 40s and found the best way to see everything was to walk, nothing is much more than 15mins away. The metro is 2 mins away if you want it. The b&b is set right by the side of the Spanish steps and through the day is packed full of tourists just sitting around. The complementary breakfast is Ok if you don't want much to eat in the morning, failing this Macdonalds is just around the corner LOL. The rooms including the bathroom are quite small but clean, we had a power shower with a large cubical. Overall the b&b was perfect for us. Rome really opens your eyes and the attractions are breathtaking, the churches have unbelievable decor / paintings. My only moan was the prices of food and drink, I know your in a city but 14 euros for 2 coffees is taking the p. The food is good but you don't need to be a chef to knock up pasta or pitza. If your thinking of going to Rome then I recommend it and if you stay at Piazza di Spagna View, Rome I think you will be OK.

Reviews.Title: “great deal!”
Reviews.Author: KristyW87
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small bathroom even smaller but i hear thats common with most hotels but for the price you cant beat it. The complimentary breakfast was amazing! That alone is worth staying here. The location was also amazing, a little loud at night but i didnt care. staff was also friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: linfer
Reviews.Content: Honestly, the location cannot be beat! When you walk out the front door, you are in the Piazza di Spagna. Our receptionist was a very nice, friendly and helpful girl. A spectacular view of the Spanish Steps from our window. Our room was very tight for three. Clean but definitely dated. Could use a makeover with the bedspreads and curtains. I gave this a low rating mainly because the bathroom toilet did not flush properly which was a problem and because the room was small. An OK place for a night or two, but I would not want to stay longer. BUT this was definitely a value for the location and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: kayesarah1
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the fact that breakfast was included in the price of the room. The location is wonderful--the Spanish steps are 2 minutes away, and there is a metro stop nearby that can take you anywhere else in the city. We were a little disappointed that there was no wifi, but they did have free internet hook-up in all the rooms. They also had a computer available downstairs that you could use (provided that you buy an internet pass). The rooms were comfortable, and the bathroom was bigger than most European bathrooms. All together, this hotel is a pretty great find if you're visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A view of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: travelingtripper
Reviews.Content: A great location to be in Rome. The view was marvelous overlooking the historic Spanish Steps. Tourists would be jealous to stay here. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms were quite dated and could be cleaner. Linens were clean, so that was good. Bathroom was tiny, again very dated, but functional. Having ensuite in a Rome hotel is lucky, so I was glad to have that at least. Breakfast was served in hotel room as part of the rate. This hotel is considered a "guest house" so it is within a building with other commercial or private dwellings. The building where the hotel is located is not marked. It is probably a good idea to take the address and a photo of the building so you go to the correct location. Near the door, the intercom reflects the name "Piazza di Spagna View". Ring the buzzer and someone will direct you to the 4th floor. Take the tiny lift up and there you are. Be prepared for noise when the windows are open as this is a huge tourist attraction and there is noise night and day. One of the things that made the hotel even more charming and made one feel like they were in the true Rome! Some pictures are provided, but just could not do it justice. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hardly recommended”
Reviews.Author: DidiCori
Reviews.Content: Good location (metro station is next to hotel, you can walk to really very nice places, etc.), good staff (polite, helpful), clean rooms, good breakfast, good view, good sound insolation (spanish steps is really crowded and noisy beginning early in the morning ending late at night, but we slept like babies, AC was working in sleep mode, quiet, refreshing, cooling). And the lady in charge offered the best tiramisu in rome we think, it was really very very very delicious, guess it was pronto just a metro away :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing setting and mood”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraOhio
Reviews.Content: Views from the room onto the Spanish Steps - small personal space with individualized attention. People were warm, friendly and very helpful with suggestions. Breakfast (roll selection, juices and several coffee varieties) was wonderful. This was a part of the culture and history-- not just some hotel. Rome Free Tour leaves 50 feet away - shopping everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Little jem great location”
Reviews.Author: anne00Bristol
Reviews.Content: small and friendly hotel by the spanish steps,shops, places to eat, and the metro just outside,didnt bother with metro,walked everywere,we had two 60 year olds with us and didnt have a problem getting around on foot,if you eat by the steps be prepared to pay, prices were high,if they bring nibbles to the table ask the price BEFORE you eat we payed 12 euro for bread!!."THE HOTEL" buzz to get in, you are on the 4 floor but there is a lift,we had a room overlooking the steps,breakfast is served in your room nice touch,there is a small fridge with drinks resonable price,our only gripe was the bathroom needs tlc however it was clean with plenty of shower gels and soap.

Reviews.Title: “Location 10/10 apartment presentation let it down”
Reviews.Author: TravelRobyn
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Rome was for approximate 1 week. The location of this accommodation was perfect. The unfortunate part however the apartment was not as advertised and minor maintenance not attended to eg light bulbs not working. This ad has now been amended however I am still awaiting a part refund/reimbursement for the washing machine that was not in the apartment. Although this may be minor to some I did not want to waste my travel time at the laundromat. I have not been able to get a response to my emails since this stay in November.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible business ethics”
Reviews.Author: KLouChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and spectacular views! Unfortunately, despite the fact we had a reservation for 2 rooms for 3 nights, when we arrived the woman in charge told us that our first night's stay would have to be in another hotel way far out of the city center (she had pre-arranged it for us, rushed us as quickly as possible out of Piazza di Spagna View, and paid for our cab to the other hotel) because the air conditioning was broken. We said we didn't care if the AC didn't work, but she said the technician would be working in our rooms late into the night. Well, it turns the AC problem was a lie and actually other people were in our rooms and she had double booked our first night. The maid who served breakfast was lovely, but the woman in charge was totally untrustworthy and rude. Booking this hotel is a risk unless you don't mind having your trip broken up with travel between hotels and ending up staying in another large tour-type hotel far away from the city center where you never would have considered staying in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for its price..!!!perfect view..!!perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: mammutis
Reviews.Content: GREAT LITTLE HOTEL!!! the truth is that we didn't expect much of our hotel as we couldn't find many reviews and fotos through internet and we had heard that most hotels in rome are really old and their service is not the best. We were really surprised to find out that our choise couldn't have been better..!!! Both rooms were spotless and had perfect view of spanish steps!!!all hotels near by were double even triple price and i m sure they didn't had such a nice view..!! the rooms looked much better in reality than in all fotos we saw online untill that time in booking sites... the walls were covered with nice yellow cloth and the whole floor had nice warm carpet! the girl in the reception was really really kind and sweet and wiilling to answer in any question! the location just couldn't be better...everything was within walking distance...and the biggest shopping street just opposite! and of those who dont like walking the metro station is just in the corner..! make sure you remember the address as the hotel is in the fourth floor of a big white building in piazza di spagna and has no big label to easily spot it(something that scared us at the beggining but it seams that many many hotels in rome are like that..only a floor inside a building...and prooved to be absolutely safe) we read in some reviews not to expect much of the breakfast but it came out just fine....croisant,bread,butter,honey,marmelade,rusks,juise,yoghurt,coffee(and they were really kind to bring me milk as i didn't drink coffee)which was served in our room the hour we have asked. having breakfast with such a view was just amazing....! the truth is that you must not expect much of the bathroom as it's a simple old type bathroom however it is so clean and the whole room so satisfactoring that makes no difference! its not a five star hotel but i would DEFINATELY recomend it. It's far too good for it's price!and all of its rooms have the same perfect view as we descovered from outside

Reviews.Title: “Good view, central location”
Reviews.Author: 50_years
Reviews.Content: The hotel is now a guest house. Only ten rooms and they need to be refurbished, but still nice. It was clean. The front desk is not open 24 hours so remember to bring your key when going outside. Personel at front desk is very helpful as long as you meet the one with language skills. The other one speaks only Italian, which I don't. This could be a problem, but with all the help from the other one we had a pleasant stay. The continental breakfast is served in your room and there are no restaurant. All rooms except one do have a view of the Spanish Steps and the church on top. We loved the view. Remeber the adress to the hotel because there are no sign outside the building. You have to find the right door (easy) and ring the bell to get in. The lift is ready for the museum, but I still suggest that you use it because the hotel is on the 4th floor. We tested the nearby bar to the left on the top of the stairs. It was realy expencive. I would stay there again. The location is perfect for sightseeing and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: PIGANDLAMB
Reviews.Content: Location cannot be beaten. Rooms a little dated but very clean. Breakfast delivered to room and you cannot beat the view, eating breakfast overlooking the spanish steps. Staff very pleasant and helpfull. Have stayed in Marcella Royal hotel at twice the price and found this the better option. Would definately stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Piazza di Spagna View
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza di Spagna, 20, 00187 Rome, Italy
